headline: NCR Voyix, Corpay strike deal to expand fleet card acceptance at US fuel stations
summary: Investing.com -- NCR Voyix Corp said on Tuesday it will integrate Corpay Inc’s fleet card payments into its point-of-sale systems for fuel stations across the United States as it expands its commercial payments capabilities.

raw.headline: NCR Voyix, Corpay strike deal to expand fleet card acceptance at US fuel stations

headline: 3 Stocks That Might Be Trading Below Intrinsic Value By Up To 48.3%
summary: In the current U.S. market landscape, stocks have rebounded as President Trump softened his stance on China, leading to a positive response from major indices like the Nasdaq and S&P 500. Amidst this volatility, identifying stocks that may be trading below their intrinsic value can offer investors potential opportunities for growth, especially in sectors responding well to recent developments such as AI and technology partnerships.

headline: NCR Voyix Partners with Corpay to Enable Fleet Card Acceptance with Voyix Connect
summary: ATLANTA, October 13, 2025--NCR Voyix Corporation (NYSE: VYX) ("NCR Voyix" or the "Company"), a leading global provider of digital commerce solutions, and Corpay, Inc. ("Corpay") (NYSE: CPAY), a global leader in corporate payments and one of the largest providers of fleet cards, today announced a partnership to enable Corpay payment acceptance for commercial fuel transactions at NCR Voyix’s cloud-native POS systems in the U.S.

headline: XPEL And 2 Stocks That Could Be Trading Below Estimated Value
summary: As U.S.-China trade tensions flare up once more, major stock indexes have experienced notable declines, with the Nasdaq falling 3.6% and the S&P 500 down by 2.7% in a single session. In such volatile market conditions, identifying stocks that may be trading below their estimated value can offer potential opportunities for investors seeking to navigate the current economic landscape effectively.
